teacherQueries.text: Students confused about subtraction borrowing when there's a zero in tens place
teacherQueries.advice:
Try this 3-step pebble activity:
1. Use 10 pebbles in groups. Show 13-7 concretely.
2. When borrowing, physically move 1 group of 10 to ones place.
3. Practice with zero: 40-7 requires 'opening' the 4 tens.

teacherQueries.text: Students don't understand what 1/2 means. They think it's just a number
teacherQueries.advice:
Build fraction understanding:
1. Use paper folding: fold paper into halves, quarters.
2. Draw and shade: 'Show me 3/4 of this rectangle'
3. Compare fractions using same-size circles.

teacherQueries.text: Class is very noisy and I can't get their attention during lessons
teacherQueries.advice:
Improve classroom flow:
1. Start with clear signal (clap pattern) for attention
2. Use transition songs between activities
3. Assign classroom helpers (materials, attendance)
